org.openimaj.video.xuggle

Class XuggleAudio

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.audio.Audio
      • org.openimaj.audio.AudioStream
        • org.openimaj.video.xuggle.XuggleAudio
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<SampleChunk>

    public class XuggleAudio
extends AudioStream
    A wrapper for the Xuggle audio decoding system into the OpenIMAJ audio system.
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • XuggleAudio

        public XuggleAudio(String url)

        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the file to read

      • XuggleAudio

        public XuggleAudio(String u,
                   boolean loop)
        Default constructor that takes the location of a file to read. This can either be a filename or a URL. The second parameter determines whether the file will loop indefinitely. If so, nextSampleChunk() will never return null; otherwise this method will return null at the end of the video.
        Parameters:
        u - The URL of the file to read
        loop - Whether to loop indefinitely

      • XuggleAudio

        public XuggleAudio(InputStream stream)
        Construct a xuggle audio object from the stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - The stream

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Returns the length of the audio stream in milliseconds. If the length is unknown (for a live stream for example), then this method should return -1.
        Specified by:
        getLength in class AudioStream
        Returns:
        The length in milliseconds, or -1
        See Also:
        AudioStream.getLength()

      • seek

        public void seek(long timestamp)
        Seeks the audio to the given timestamp. The timestamp of the audio should be checked after calling seek() as the seek method may not succeed if the stream does not support seeking.
        Overrides:
        seek in class AudioStream
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp to seek to
        See Also:
        AudioStream.seek(long)

        public void close()
